title: More shares traded in SGX in August
content:
Turnover in the securities market rose to S$28.1 billion last month, up 16 per cent from the previous…  
SINGAPORE: Securities trading activity in the Singapore Exchange (SGX) continued to gain pace in August, with more shares changing hands among investors. 

Latest data released by SGX on Monday (Sep 7) showed that total turnover in the securities market rose 16 per cent month-on-month to S$28.1 billion last month. This is also 34 per cent higher from the same period last year. 

The daily average traded value was S$1.5 billion, up 35 per cent month-on-month and 49 per cent higher than a year ago. 

There were two new listings on Catalist raising S$40 million last month. This brings the total number of listed companies on Catalist to 164 with a total market capitalisation of S$8.9 billion.
